before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"80f10","text":"1) Growth chamber or laboratory space with a fixed recorded temperature and light:dark cycle is needed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v0eb","text":"25C temperature ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5vsl","text":"70% RH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acb6q","text":"12:12 L:D cycle ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crn4p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f53f","text":"2) Printing labels for each step of the experiment that can be filled in prior to starting each step with speed the process along immensely. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17qvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a0cc","text":"Entomotoxicology laboratory experiments have limitations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekudr","text":"1)  Inject a  single drug into excised tissue after death, neglecting metabolization and thus resulting in a scenario where drug interactions are not comparable to those that would be observed in real-life. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7123","text":"            We suggest utilizing treatments that examine a single drug, a single metabolite of that drug, mixture of the parent drug and metabolite, as well as, a mixture of different drugs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ept6h","text":"2) These experiments are closed systems and do not allow new energy or matter to enter the system, thereby presenting a single predictable, inevitable solution. An open system, such as field experiments, consistently gain and lose energy and matter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0nfh","text":"            We suggest performing toxicological screening on decomposition fluid of humans and using this fluid ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9psqd","text":"            the same as you would a drug mixture to preform experiments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caha7","text":"3) Postmortem redistribution - diffusion, neoformation and metabolism ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69bue","text":"             This is an important factor to consider but a true limitation of a development study of this nature.    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvn3k","text":"             Metabolomic analysis may help elucidate these interactions in experiments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"345nc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ts9n","text":"This protocol was developed specifically for examining the impact of drug exposure on forensically important phenotypes (i.e., developmental duration, size, survivorship) of larval blow flies. This protocol was implemented using a laboratory colony of the black blow fly, Phormia regina (Meigen), a common and abundant blow fly in the eastern and southeastern United States. The end goal of this protocol is the generation of drug-specific developmental datasets that can be used for estimating larval age, which can be used in death investigations to then infer a minimum postmortem interval.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":272,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8lmmj","text":"Fly colonies should be presented with a fresh protein source daily for ~1 week prior to the start of experiments. For this experiment, we exposed colonies to a kimwipe soaked in chicken blood in a 3 oz bath cup each day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hnil","text":"24 - 48 hours prior to the start of experiments, provide the colony with ~5g chicken liver and a kimwipe  soaked with chicken blood in a 3 oz cup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cblko","text":"Check for eggs every 3 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tr59","text":"Once eggs are observed, remove them from the cage and record the time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"oot4","text":"Weigh out 200g of lean pork. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64iil","text":"For each observation period, place eggs on ~10g lean pork muscle and incubate under ambient conditions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bmeh7","text":"Add treatment specific drug to lean pork.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"394rm","text":"Blend pork in treatment specific blenders for 45 seconds. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fb3n6","text":"Blend pork in treatment specific blenders for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1028c","text":"Divide blended pork into 4 individual pre-weighed 3oz bath cups with 50g of drugged pork in in each. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80djk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sg7s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"co707","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dmdku","text":"Record the exact weight of the 3oz bath cup and the drugged pork using a balance. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59i5e","text":"Use a camel-hair paintbrush and a hand counter to add 100 individual larvae onto each replicate. Record the time when complete. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ifak","text":"Place the 3oz bath cup in 3\" of sterile sand within a 32oz deli cup and cover with a paper napkin and 2 rubber bands. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"devih","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"44blt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tb4m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ae421","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fjqgi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fhkbp","text":"See image of experimental housing under description ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C452A559138A11EFB8380A58A9FEAC02","height":412,"id":478097,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"109b8\",\"text\":\"Experimental housing example\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Maggot Hotel-01.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qkc2b39qx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6tb39qx.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qu6sb39qx.webp","width":550}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9n2e","text":"Check for egg hatch after 8 hours and then hourly thereafter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adu2k","text":"Observe the development of larvae every 8 hours and record results until wandering larvae are observed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"290j0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egk87","text":"We sampled at: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8767l","text":"12:00 AM ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37bvg","text":"8:00 AM ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"913ph","text":"4:00 PM ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7sqht","text":"Once larvae are observed dispersing from the resource, remove feeding cup and sieve sand through a flour sieve (40mm mesh) into a cleaned plastic bin. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3g3rl","text":"Once pupae are observed during the sieving process, use soft forceps to place each individual pupa into 1oz plastic cups with lids and appropriate labels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbu2j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ds6e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7rdnn","text":"Label each lid with:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5u6k5","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ko19","text":"Treatment: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5n7d8","text":"Replicate:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dt409","text":"Date:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4doo3","text":"Sampling collection time: ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dng2o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31lir","text":"Allow flies to completely sclerotize after eclosion.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7clo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"959d9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d4dda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3nfc1","text":"This may take a few hours.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4hkj1","text":"Record the number of wandering larvae present.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"balgl","text":"Collect 50% of the wandering larvae present in a labeled 20ml scintillation vial, add boiling water to kill, then strain off water and add 70-85% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48kvu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6utu9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"krdv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bl24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6759j","text":"Two labels should be included with preserved samples: one written on the vial cap and one written on paper within the vials.  The following information should be present on the labels:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bko3l","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"23mqo","text":"Treatment: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"70rhe","text":"Replicate:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"djnbb","text":"Date:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"95j21","text":"Collection time: ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8frmp","text":"After collecting all pupae from all treatments during the sampling period, immediately weigh each individual pupa to the nearest microgram (  ).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":140,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tlbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3ttg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ka75","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"","error":false,"guid":"6C4A613012F811EFBB390A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dk2ta","text":"Pupa must be weighed shortly after forming as the duration of pupation may be shorter than anticipated due to the drug treatment. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1r5r0","text":"Check for adult eclosion every 8 hours and record results observed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52pd7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"752qg","text":"Record the emergence date and time for each individual. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ere7s","text":"Freeze adult flies at -20C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f42o6","text":"Record sex of the adult flies. Blow flies exhibit sexual dimorphism that can be easily seen with the naked eye or a dissecting microscope. The eyes of males touch, or are spaced very close together. Females typically have a large gap between their eyes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"97vda","text":"Record mortality of pupae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t4q4","text":"After all larvae have dispersed away from the pork, take a final mass of the pork using an analytical balance and record the date and time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"68k74","text":"Freeze remaining pork for metabolomic analysis via UHPLC-HRMS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"coqps","text":"Label the cryovial with the same information from previous vial.Take a 10% sub-sample of wandering larvae for metabolomic analysis via UHPLC-HRMS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"spf2","text":"Freeze samples at   using liquid nitrogen in a cryovial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3rrv2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cp41","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8d0u0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h7nt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47eq4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9dg05","text":"Label the cryovial with the same information from previous vial.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9fuut","text":"Return sieved sand and feeding cup to the replicate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fq6fn","text":"Replace paper napkin and rubber bands ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78h97","text":"Wash plastic 12\"x9\" bin used for sand cast off with distilled water and dry before sampling the next replicate/treatment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"27u15","text":"Calibrate stereomicroscope and camera using the appropriate scale ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"427m1","text":"Place all larvae from a scintillation vial under the microscope and take a photo","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"67ldb","text":"Digitally measure each larvae to the nearest mm and record ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mi74","text":"Fly colonies should be established using local populations of blow flies. Adult flies can be baited with aged organ or muscle tissue, or they can be collected from a vertebrate carcass, refuse, or feces. Flies should be collected with an aerial sweep net, sorted to the desired species, and placed in a BugDorm or other enclosure specifically for insects. Flies can be maintained at ambient conditions in a laboratory and given sugar, water, and cultured buttermilk ad libitum. To ensure sufficient genetic diversity and to minimize the risk for genetic drift within the colony, wild fly collections should span multiple timepoints and the total founding generation (G0) should be ~200 individuals. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":466,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59c10","text":"Record behavior of larvae in each replicate at every observation. Do not disturb the pork, only record what you can visibly see. Record any visible larval masses, dead or presumed dead larvae observed in the cup and movement/behavior of larvae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgqaa","text":"Weigh each individual adult to the nearest microgram (  )with a microbalance and record.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"","error":false,"guid":"6D09AFC612F811EFBB390A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkrss","text":"Dry flies at     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bh89e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"60","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csecs","text":"Record any abnormalities in fly morphology (e.g., wings not formed).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
